text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Ryan a cloud support engineer
here at the Adis office in Northern
Virginia today I'm going to show you how
to reset the administrator password for
an Amazon elastic compute Cloud Windows
instance let's get started after logging
into the Eis Management console we can
navigate to the Amazon ec2
console next we can go ahead and select
instances
we can create a temporary slh helper
instance that is in the same
availability Zone as the instance that
needs the password reset or a running
instance that can be connected by using
RDP in the same availability Zone can be
used for a demonstration purposes let's
create a helper
instance it's best practice to create a
backup of the instance that requires the
password reset by creating a snapshot or
an Ami backup before making any changes
to the original instance you should
consider any changes that will occur
when the instance is stopped for example
if the instance doesn't have an elastic
IP address allocated then the public IP
will
change as soon as the backup is
completed go ahead and stop the instance
by selecting the instance instance State
stop
instance when the instance is fully
stopped navigate to the storage Tab and
then select the root EBS volume the root
EBS volume can be identified by the
device name /dev
sda1 now select the volume go to actions
and choose
detach after we refresh to verify that
the volume state shows as
available detach the root volume of the
instance and attach it to the helper
instance mentioned previously in the
same availability
Zone after the volume is attached as a
secondary Drive connect to the helper
instance by using
RDP when you're connected to the
instance we can go ahead and download E2
rescue from our Adis public
documentation and then extract the
folder
we can now run the ec2 rescue
application and go through the launch
wizard select offline instance and make
sure that the correct volume was
provided by confirming the amount of
storage and device
name next choose diagnose and rescue to
reset the administrator
password
now that the password is reset you can
finish up using e to rescue and
disconnect from the helper
instance after disconnecting from the
helper instance go ahead and attach the
EBS root volume back to the original
affected instance by stopping the helper
instance
the key thing to note here is to attach
the Amazon EBS root volume with the
device name as /dev
sda1 finally start the original instance
and confirm that the password was
reset
so now you know how to reset the
administrator password for an ec2
Windows
instance thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
AWS
[Music]
